item.title: Sandi add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "It may help to understand human affairs to be clear that most of the great triumphs and tragedies of history are caused, not by people being fundamentally good or fundamentally bad, but by people being fundamentally people." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "[t]he child must have a valuable thing which is called imagination. The child must have a secret world in which live things that never were. It is necessary that she <i>believe</i>. She must start out by believing things too ugly for living in, the child can reach back and live in her imagination." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Everything that happens before Death is what counts." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Glenda Burgess
item.description: "Physicists say we are made of stardust. Intergalactic debris and far-flung atoms, shards of carbon nanomatter rounded up by gravity to circle the sun. As atoms pass through an eternal revolving door of possible form, energy and mass dance in fluid relationship. We are stardust, we are man, we are thought. We are story." -- Glenda Burgess

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The road to hell is paved with adverbs." -- Stephen King

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Peace begins with a smile.." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "I would rather walk with a friend in the dark, than alone in the light." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Henrik Ibsen
item.description: "The majority is never right. Never, I tell you! That's one of these lies in society that no free and intelligent man can help rebelling against. Who are the people that make up the biggest proportion of the population -- the intelligent ones or the fools?" -- Henrik Ibsen

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "[D]on't ever apologize to an author for buying something in paperback, or taking it out from a library (that's what they're there for. Use your library). Don't apologize to this author for buying books second hand, or getting them from bookcrossing or borrowing a friend's copy. What's important to me is that people read the books and enjoy them, and that, at some point in there, the book was bought by someone. And that people who like things, tell other people. The most important thing is that people read... " -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Austin Grossman
item.description: "When your laboratory explodes, lacing your body with a supercharged elixir, what do you do? You don't just lie there. You crawl out of the rubble, hideously scarred, and swear vengeance on the world. You keep going. You keep trying to take over the world." -- Austin Grossman

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sandi add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Cut out all these exclamation points. An exclamation point is like laughing at your own joke." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Paranoid? Probably. But just because you're paranoid doesn't mean there isn't an invisible demon about to eat your face." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "Growth for the sake of growth is the ideology of the cancer cell." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "I'm not upset that you lied to me, I'm upset that from now on I can't believe you." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Austin Grossman
item.description: "There's a fine line between a superpower and a chronic medical condition." -- Austin Grossman

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Austin Grossman
item.description: "When you can't bear something but it goes on anyway, the person who survives isn't you anymore; you've changed and become someone else, a new person, the one who did bear it after all." -- Austin Grossman

item.title: Sandi add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "It's all right to be afraid. You just don't let it stop you from doing your job." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "There's more magic in a baby's first giggle than in any firestorm a wizard can conjure up, and don't let anyone tell you any different." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Sandi add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You donâ€™t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Sandi add a quote by William Shakespeare
